text:
Two drugmakers said they had “positive” results from a midstage study of an experimental Alzheimer’s drug, offering signs a medicine could finally disrupt the disease’s memory-robbing course, though experts said it was too soon to say the drug marks a real advance.

The news drove up the stocks of the companies, Boston biotech Biogen Inc. and Japan’s Eisai Co., by double-digit percentages on Friday while raising the hopes of caregivers and doctors.

...
title: Drugmakers Call Experimental Alzheimer’s Drug Study Outcome Positive
